turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Caldicot, Monmouthshire.
turn.1: What is the local government in Caldicot, Monmouthshire?
turn.2: Caldicot Town Council comprises seventeen elected or co-opted town councillors, from five community wards, namely Castle, Dewstow, Green Lane, Severn and West End. Caldicot Castle, Dewstow, Green Lane, Severn and West End are also county wards to Monmouthshire County Council, each electing one county councillor.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: Caldicot is the location of Caldicot Castle and lake.
turn.5: What are some of the recreational activities?
turn.6: The area has popular waymarked footpaths along the Caldicot Levels and the coastal path can be walked.
turn.7: What other communities and social groups?
turn.10: To the north-west, Dewstow House dates from c.1804.
turn.11: Is it open to the public?
turn.12: Extensive gardens and grottoes built after 1895 have been undergoing restoration since 2000 and are now open to the public.
